relevant_findings.general: Patient appears uncomfortable, grimacing and in pain, moving very little in bed.
relevant_findings.neck: Supple, JVP low, no lymphadenopathy appreciated.
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, moving air well and symmetrically, no wheezes, rales or rhonchi appreciated.
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Tachycardic rate, regular rhythm, S1 and S2 clear and of good quality, no murmurs, rubs or gallops appreciated.
relevant_findings.abdomen: PEG site intact, clean without erythema, several surgical scars well healed; abdominal tenderness mostly in RUQ, guarding present but no rebound tenderness; hypoactive bowel sounds; abdomen thin, scaphoid, non-distended.
relevant_findings.extremities: Cachectic with prominent protuberances, no erythema, edema, or hematomas.
relevant_findings.neurological: Cranial Nerves II-XII grossly intact, motor and sensory function grossly intact in bilateral upper and lower extremities.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Confusion, pain in RUQ worse with movement or touching, severe abdominal pain, bilious vomiting with no blood, cannot recall last bowel movement.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient developed fever and confusion following transfer; abdominal pain worsened throughout the day.
